description:
Giuseppe Cammarota - Activity Map from space: supporting mine clearance with Python
[EuroPython 2015]
[22 July 2015]
[Bilbao, Euskadi, Spain]

Removing UneXploded Ordnance (UXO) from minefields at the end of a
conflict is a very time-consuming and expensive operation. Advanced
satellite image processing can detect changes and activities on the
ground and represent them on a map that can be used by operators to
classify more dangerous zones and safer areas, potentially reducing
the time spent on field surveys.

We exploit space-borne radar Earth images together with thematic data
for mapping activities on the ground using numpy, scipy and gdal. The
Activity Map generation process to be shown will be implemented using
IPython Notebook.
title: Activity Map from space: supporting mine clearance with Python
